Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, which has flaked away in places, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and very faint traces of at least six lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.179)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36413) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36413)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 270 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13459 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
